parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Formerly, before. Neuter of proteros as adverb; previously.
Slanderous; subst: a blasphemer. From a derivative of blapto and pheme; scurrilious, i.e. Calumnious, or impious.
A persecutor. From dioko; a persecutor.
An insolent, insulting, or violent man. From hubrizo; an insulter, i.e. Maltreater.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.
